intro: Pachira liesneri, commonly known as the Ecuadorian pachira, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the western Amazon Basin, specifically Ecuador and Peru, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by distinctive, three-lobed seed pods. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to indoor environments.
